title: Senate votes 98-0 to confirm Biden’s nominee to run the FAA
description: Michael Whitaker is a former deputy administrator at the Federal Aviation Administration and most recently served as chief operating officer of a company developing an air taxi.

title: DA and police have discussed charging Jonathan Majors' ex-girlfriend with domestic assault, source says
description: On the eve of Marvel actor Jonathan Majors’ next court hearing on charges of assaulting his ex-girlfriend Grace Jabbari, prosecutors and police have discussed charging her with domestic assault, a senior law enforcement official briefed on the matter told NBC News Tuesday.

title: Florida officials ask Supreme Court to block rulings limiting anti-drag show law
description: Florida is asking the U.S. Supreme Court to block lower court rulings that prohibit the enforcement of a new law targeting drag shows.

title: Around 20 minutes of exercise a day may balance out the harms of sitting, study finds
description: Too much sitting has been linked to an increased risk of early death, regardless of how much exercise you get, but a new study suggests daily activity may counteract the harmful effects of sitting.

title: Tennessee faces federal lawsuit over decades-old penalties targeting HIV-positive people
description: LGBTQ and civil rights advocates on Tuesday filed a federal lawsuit challenging Tennessee’s aggravated prostitution statute, arguing that the law stems from the decades-old AIDS scare and discriminates against HIV-positive people.

title: As Republicans fight, a House paralyzed by 'bad blood' faces a major to-do list
description: Still without a House speaker, Congress has just three-and-a-half weeks left to fund the government or cause another damaging shutdown.

title: The best holiday gifts for bookworms
description: Find the perfect holiday gift for the book lover in your life. We rounded up functional things like neck lights and bookmarks along with presents that’ll elevate their reading experiences.

title: A 200-year-old sassy vampire from the video game Baulder’s Gate 3 is the internet’s new boyfriend
description: The Baulder’s Gate 3 video game character Astarion – who has a six-pack and perfectly tousled silver hair – is the internet's latest "babygirl."

title: Sacramento Police stop mother and 8-year-old son at gunpoint over mistaken identity
description: A Black mother is demanding an apology after Sacramento police officers pulled her and her 8-year-old son over at gunpoint, mistaking the child for a teen wanted for two felonies.

title: Ohio man pleads guilty and admits to attack on LGBTQ-friendly church
description: An Ohio man pleaded guilty to federal charges stemming from his "reprehensible" bid to burn down a church that's supportive of LGBTQ rights, officials said Tuesday.

title: Rash of violence has not deterred Black parents from keeping their kids at HBCUs
description: A string of recent on-campus shootings at HBCUs has instilled fear in students and their families. But Black parents say they still want their children to have the HBCU experience.

title: Palestinian American woman whose son was killed in apparent anti-Muslim attack in Illinois urges people to 'pray for peace'
description: The Palestinian American woman whose 6-year-old son was fatally stabbed in what authorities have described as a hate crime in a Chicago suburb said she harbors no hatred, but believes in the pursuit of justice.

title: 'Too smart to want the job': Why no women are running for speaker of the House
description: Nearly a dozen men have entered the race for speaker since Kevin McCarthy was ousted, not a single woman has joined them.

title: Oregon State University warns to 'avoid all robots' after bomb threat involving food delivery robots
description: Oregon State University urged students and staff to steer clear of an automated food delivery service on Tuesday, fearing the robots could contain explosives.

title: Ancient landscape formed by rivers revealed deep under Antarctic ice
description: Antarctica has not always been a desolate land of ice and snow.

title: What is 'superfog'? Deadly conditions behind Louisiana's 158-vehicle pileup explained
description: A dangerously thick “superfog” that caused a huge vehicle pileup north of New Orleans on Monday was made worse by wildfires burning nearby, according to local officials.

title: Boyfriend of Alicia Navarro, teen found 4 years after vanishing, charged with child sexual abuse
description: The man who authorities describe as the boyfriend of Alicia Navarro — the teenage girl who walked into a Montana police station four years after she vanished in Arizona — was arrested on charges of child sexual abuse after explicit images were found on his cellphone, officials said Tuesday.

title: NHL rescinds ban on rainbow-colored Pride tape, allowing players to use it on the ice
description: NHL players will be allowed to use Pride tape this season after all with the reversal of a ban that sparked a backlash around hockey and among LGBTQ advocates.

title: Virginia GOP mails voters explicit flyers on Democrat Susanna Gibson
description: Virginia's Republican Party has sent voters fliers containing explicit content about Democrat Susanna Gibson, who is mired in a sex scandal while running for the Virginia House of Delegates.

title: 'I am not OK': Off-duty Alaska Airlines pilot accused of trying to shut engines 'wrestled' in cockpit
description: Joseph Emerson was sitting in the cockpit of an Alaska Airlines flight engaging in "casual conversation" when he attempted to grab two handles that would have shut down the plane's engines.

title: Record-breaking Spiderman video game confuses Puerto Rican and Cuban flags
description: Players of the highly anticipated video game “Marvel’s Spider-Man 2” took to social media to ask developers to correct scenes confusing the Puerto Rican and Cuban flags.

title: Club Q changes course, will reopen in a new Colorado Springs location
description: Club Q, an LGBTQ nightclub in Colorado Springs, was the site of a mass shooting in November, which left five people dead and many more injured.

title: Released hostage says she went through hell. But she had praise — and a word of peace — for her captors.
description: After she was freed, Israeli hostage Yocheved Lifshitz offered a handshake to her Hamas captors.

title: Day of the Dead diapers, books? Actress Jessica Alba, Latina entrepreneurs team up
description: Actress Jessica Alba, Honest Company cofounder and Lil' Libros cofounders Patty Rodriguez and Ariana Stein tout Día de los Muertos through diapers, books and games.

title: ‘Reservation Dogs’ star slams ‘Killers of the Flower Moon’ for ‘helpless' Osage characters
description: Devery Jacobs, the Indigenous actor best known for playing Elora on three seasons of FX and Hulu’s “Reservation Dogs,” took to X to share the “strong feelings” she had about Martin Scorsese’s “Killers of the Flower Moon.”

title: DATELINE THURSDAY SNEAK PEEK: Dangerous Secret
description: Dennis Murphy reports Thursday, October 26 at 10/9c on NBC.

title: Meta sued by 33 state AGs for addictive features targeting kids
description: A bipartisan group of 33 attorneys general is suing Meta over addictive features aimed at kids and teens, according to a complaint filed Tuesday in a federal court in California.

title: Manhunt in Massachusetts for 'armed and dangerous' military vet suspected of killing wife
description: A manhunt is underway for an Air Force veteran suspected of fatally shooting his wife at their home in Massachusetts, police announced this week.

title: West Maui to reopen for tourism on Nov. 1, mayor says
description: All of West Maui except for burned-out sections of historic Lahaina will reopen to tourism on Nov. 1 following the deadliest U.S. wildfire in more than century, the mayor of Maui County said Monday.

title: Trump lawyers argue Senate impeachment acquittal means 2020 election interference case should be dismissed
description: Donald Trump is seeking to toss the federal election obstruction case against him, arguing that his actions are protected by the First Amendment.

title: Autoworkers strike expands again with walkout at GM SUV plant
description: The United Auto Workers union expanded its strike against Detroit's Big Three for the second consecutive day as members at a major General Motors manufacturing plant walked off the job.

title: 8 kids abducted from Arkansas found safe in California parking lot; mom arrested
description: Eight children who were abducted from Arkansas were found in the parking lot of a restaurant in California over the weekend, according to police, who said they arrested the children's mother.

title: Woman whose body was found 35 years ago in a suitcase is identified
description: A body found wrapped in plastic inside a Georgia dumpster 35 years ago has been identified as that of Chong Un Kim, 26, officials announced Monday.

title: Nigeria's paramilitary raids birthday party for gay people, 76 arrested
description: Dozens were arrested for attending a birthday party for gay people in northern Nigeria.

title: Ex-Trump lawyer Jenna Ellis pleads guilty in Georgia election interference case
description: Former Trump lawyer Jenna Ellis pled guilty on Tuesday morning in the Georgia election interference case, becoming the fourth co-defendant to accept a plea deal instead of going to trial.

title: Freed Israeli hostage describes Hamas 'hell,' says she was taken through a network of tunnels
description: blog card linkout

title: Filipino caregiver in Israel explains her decision to stay with her patient
description: A Filipino caregiver in Israel says she feels it’s her “duty” to remain with her elderly employer, for whom she’s worked the last five months, despite the monumental tensions and instability in the region.

title: Michael Cohen testifies against Trump in civil fraud trial
description: blog linkout

title: Che Flores becomes NBA's first out nonbinary and transgender referee
description: Che Flores is the NBA’s first out nonbinary and transgender referee, making that revelation in a story published by GQ on Monday.

title: China ousts missing defense minister in new leadership shakeup
description: China announced the removal of Gen. Li Shangfu as defense minister on Tuesday, the latest ousting of a senior leader who had disappeared from public view.

title: New 'Mission Impossible' movie delayed till 2025 because of ongoing actors strike
description: The eighth installment of the “Mission: Impossible” franchise has been postponed a year, signaling a new wave of release schedule juggling for Hollywood studios as the actors strike surpasses three months of work stoppage.

title:
The most giftable tech for everyone on your list
Select Giftable Tech Awards 2023
description: We tried the very best tech for gifting to friends and family in Select’s Giftable Tech Awards 2023. Shop our favorites from Apple, Sony, Bose, Nintendo and more.

title: NBC Select Giftable Tech Awards winners under $100
description: Our favorite giftable tech products under $100, according to Select’s Giftable Tech Awards 2023. Shop favorites from Amazon, JBL, Apple and more.

title: 8 officers involved in Jayland Walker’s shooting death are back on active duty, officials say
description: The eight Ohio police officers who fired scores of shots that killed Jayland Walker, a 25-year-old Black man, after a car and foot chase last year are back on active duty, officials said.

title: How we chose the Giftable Tech Awards winners
description: Here's how we chose the winners for Select's 2023 Giftable Tech Awards across categories like audio, gaming and more.

title: Chiefs wide receiver Justyn Ross arrested in suburban Kansas City
description: Chiefs wide receiver Justyn Ross was arrested Monday in suburban Kansas City and is accused of causing criminal damage of more than $25,000, according to a booking report from the sheriff’s office in Johnson County, Kansas.

title: Freed Hamas hostage describes 'hell' and House set to choose speaker candidate: Morning Rundown
description: A newly released Hamas hostage describes her experience in captivity.

title: For the third time, Republicans will nominate a speaker candidate Tuesday
description: House Republicans will vote behind closed doors for a third time to nominate a new candidate for speaker.

title: Republicans look to fill a glaring hole in their Senate recruitment map
description: Republicans have lined up a deep bench of candidates in most major battleground states in the fight to flip the Senate in 2024 — except Wisconsin, for now.

title: Hostage release raises hopes; Gaza airstrikes intensify
description: Hostage release raises hopes; Gaza airstrikes intensify

title: 'I don’t think he can win': Sen. Tim Scott says Trump isn't electable in 2024
description: Sen. Tim Scott said former President Donald Trump doesn’t have what it takes to win a general election in 2024.

title: Appeals panel questions why ‘presidential immunity’ argument wasn’t pursued years ago in Trump case
description: A lawyer for Trump argued that a lower-court judge was wrong to reject the immunity defense after it was raised three years after columnist E. Jean Carroll first sued Trump.

title: Tim Scott shifts the bulk of his resources to Iowa as campaign struggles nationally
description: The South Carolina Republican's presidential campaign said it will double staff in Iowa, moving money and staff away from New Hampshire.
